15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese
5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan, Romano & Asiago)
Note: grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.
1/2 cup cheddar cheese
2 eggs, lightly beaten
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper


- Extras
Your favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)
Parmesan cheese
Basil
Fried vegetables
Shrimp
Fish slices
Chicken pieces 
Make the Ravioli filling.

- In a small mixing bowl, add the ricotta and mash with a fork.
- Add in the 3-cheese blend, Cheddar cheese, eggs, salt, and pepper.
- Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth, paste-like consistency.
- Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. 

Make the Ravioli dough.

- Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water, oil, and salt. Mix.
- Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs, water, oil, and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed.
- Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough.
- Take the dough out of the mixing bowl, shape it into a ball, and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic.
- Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick, or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters.
- With a cookie cutter or upside-down water glass, cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15-20 dough circles).
- Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis, or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn‚Äôt suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. 

Fill the Ravioli shells.

- Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough.
- Fill a small bowl with water, dip your fingers in, and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle.
- Fold the dough in half over the filling, making a half-moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a ‚Äúhomemade‚Äù touch as well.
- Repeat this process for all your dough circles.
- Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. 

Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker.

- Roll the dough into two sheets
- Place one sheet on the ravioli maker, and form the filling cups.
- Fill with the ravioli mixture.
- Lay the second sheet of dough on top, and roll it out. This will seal in the filling.
- Remove and separate the finished raviolis.

Cook the Ravioli.

- Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil.
- Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5-6 minutes, or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test.
- If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time, you can freeze the rest 
- Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed plates

Serve it up.
Top with your favorite sauce, grate some fresh cheese over it, and enjoy!

Dear Daybreak,

The reason I played your stupid game H1Z1 was because of the survival game mode.
The battle royal was fun for a while but I was actually more upset with how it gouged 
the player base in the survival part of the game.

You proceeded to ruin Just survive by changing everything about it. You ASSUME to much about what you think the community wants rather than taking time to better understand what we want. You seem to have this knee jerk reactionary plan that is terrible and when people tell you to stop you just power forward and fuck it up more. "But I am the developer, I      make games I want to make, I make decisions I think are good." Well how has the mentality worked out? I have scoured steam to find a game that is like Just Survive. You abandoned a Gem. And we didn't abandon Just Survive because of anything other than your changes. ALL WE WANTED WAS BETTER OPTIMIZATION AND HIT REGISTRATION YOU MORONS. And you piss me off because as of now it seems like you feel like you can steal from people, the people that invested in your game. 

And the community of the game are no better. Political Correct culture has fucked up the way we interact with each other and it has been seen that Proximity Voice chat is a very risky thing to enable. Imagine Fortnite if you could talk shit and berate your opponent after shitting on him. Or Apex for that matter. 

Bring back Just Survive and stop being idiots. Make it the way it used to be and just make it run better. Try to fix magic bullet and let us deal with the glitches and such with the original base building. The raiding system was tedious but very rewarding. I think the issue of large bases can be addressed later and I have seen more people running better hardware to compensate with some of the frame issues. 

Three nights ago I counted how many people where in each Region on the current Z1 Battle Royal and counted 12 across all solo lobbies in the afternoon. This is a common occurrence. No one cares about this. In JS you can build a base chill in the server and have more of a reason to keep coming back. And Id buy your stupid ass skin cases as they came out to keep it going and I am surely not alone.

I doubt you will listen, I am sure it is too late. But maybe there is hope, maybe someone will see what everyone is telling you. Survival is why you succeeded, it brought many of us here. Everyone is doing BR. The gunplay is better in JS/H1 than Rust imo. Rust can be annoying and not as satisfying. The satisfaction of the .308 taking someones head off with a clean shot that you had to lead just right is awesome. As well as the moment you check the bag and hes LOADED with shit.  Get over yourselves and stop fucking around. Good work on PSA by the way. but everyone will just play Apex and get a similar experience that's already populated. Or destiny to ride little hovercrafts around. 

BRING BACK ORIGINAL JS!

I didn't play much at release because I had a horrible computer at the time so I played a maybe a 100 hours sitting in bushes on the Z1 original map, still had tons of fun. I started playing August 2016 (when I built my first pc) a little while before the new map "Z2" people would call it came out. Even with its flaws I was hooked, I played so much. Nothing beat this game at its peak with friends. I played so much I got (in my opinion) very good, I played in the 2017 Showdown, I qualified for and competed with other top players in Champions Arena. Winning my first games in CA is something I'll probably never forget. At one point in time this was my favorite game, probably at its best one of my favorite games of all time it was great and unique don't get me wrong it still had its problems but those problems it had then were overlookable because of the fun it was, the fun it was with friends. They had a really good thing going in my opinion from around January 2017 to the Summer of 2017, then they decided to try to fit in with the other BR's making waves at that time (notably PUBG). So they made a bunch of changes, called the "Combat Update". With one horrible update (the players begged to be reverted) they turned their peak player base of around 150k to below 30k in 6 months. I was one of the people that stayed playing for awhile after this update in hopes that one day they would fix it. They didn't want to or couldn't? They later did some changes but it was far too late. Writing this kinda makes me sad, looking back at the friends I made, the fun I had, and the things I accomplished in a game I loved. I wish I could go back in time and relive some of these memories but I can't. This games potential was insane, never would have gotten fortnite level but it definitely could have been so much more successful and probably still have a decent size active playerbase to this day. I have some videos of the old H1 on my YT in my profile bio if you're interested.

China ruined this once-phenomenal game.

Since 2017, now >65% of players on Steam are from China. <20% are from the USA.

Hello. Well, I've played this game for about 80 hours. I loved it, I climbed the ranks, I would play with friends. In 2017 I left on a two year hiatus to another country, to come back in 2019 and find this game dead.

I use to love H1Z1. Climbing the ranks, just survive, playing with friends.

I enjoyed this game for the way gunplay felt and the freedom of movement that I feel other BR's lack. 

This was one of the first BR's too.

Sadly no one plays it anymore. Due to devs no updating the game, companies like PUBG and Fortnite came and took this game down.

Then the devs updated it and made it free-to-play, but it was too late.

I'm saddened because this will remain my favorite BR. If you want to play it, go ahead. I think you'll like it, except for the fact they'll be less than 15 players every match.

I recommend the game, but I would recommend finding another game with more a player base.

you can actually queue up for games unlike pubg.

 lots of intelligent design to keep even a dwindling community appeased, what I mean by this is if a game starts with 10 or so people. the game is automatically set to a smaller circle around a smaller zone with loot, a neighborhood, a corner of town, etc and you do BR in a smaller scale. to contrast this with pubg if there aren't a ton of people in queue and you have no idea how many people are in queue since they removed that feature for whatever reason you will never be able to play the game.

you can select your region in case you want a larger match or actually wish to play squad or duo, pubg got rid of this feature and with a bunch of poor excuses while advertising VPN companies at the same time, surprised they don't make another shell company to advertise the cheats for their game as well

so as it stands, in some bizarre way H1Z1 is in a healthier spot than PUBG in regards to actually being able to play

I remember buying H1Z1 a long time ago, I played it for 30 hours and then stopped cause playing it solo was so boring. After some days I Hopped into a fives game in H1. Meet some cool people, after that, I joined the H1Z1 discord and started only queuing fives with other people cause the was the most fun thing to do in the game, at least for me. But after a while, I took a break from it again. I started playing other games etc. The other games got boring after a while so I just sat around and had nothing to play and tried H1 again, jumped into the H1 discord and then it happened I meet some people that I had fun with, those people became a part of my life. I became really good friends with them, every time after school I would run home start up my computer load up discord and jump in a call with them and I would spend at least 8-10 hours with them a day. We were pretty good at the game cause we were getting 30+ bombs most of the games and we r*ped the best teams in the game, as you can see in the clip in my profile. Then the devs started destroying the game. By each update, the game would get worse and worse and it tilted us seeing the players leave and the game getting worse, but we still had great times. We were like 15+ people that played with each other, obviously, we couldn't all que in the same match but when we ended up in the same game we would meet up in a location and fight each other and see who was better. But one day my IRL friends invited me to play fortnite(It was before fortnite blew up, it was before preseason 1 on fortnite so k*s normies) and I started ditching my H1Z1 friends I didn't even think about what the consequence would be. After a while of playing fortnite, the group had fallen apart. The guys I used to spend hours and hours in discord talking about our lives and shit. I felt like it was my fault that the group had fallen apart when I think about I want to cry no kidding we had so much fun those were probably the best years of my life. I would kill for the moments we had. There is so much more detail to this, I was only scratching the surface and tried to explain it in a short way.

H1Z1 is so annoying

1). Everytime especially the process you have to fill out, and getting B u l l S h i t.. ERROR 32, and so on, Verify some other B u l l S h i t.. Pubg just gets to the point; You load the game then you pick what mode you want to play in then you play the game, and get some CHICKEN DINNER...THAT EASY!... Im not saying pubg is perfect...yet.

2). If you make a mistake on you're DayBreaker it will automatically delivers you to this website and more paper work. No one have time for that.

3). Every time there is a patch or an update, more bugs and glitches come to the game, than the amount that are removed.

4). Hit reg is still a extremely inconsistent, and all of you saying its fine are delusional because otherwise Daybreak wouldnt be talking about in what ways they are trying to fix it.

5). The shotgun is in the game at all. The spread is so much rng its crazy. When two players from the same distance hit each other once with shotgun, one has two-hit lammy and the other one doesnt even have armor, yet the guy with a lammy dies, something is obviously wrong. When getting someone down to onehit and pushing them, you are still in a bad situation because the other player can kill you in one shot and he has peek advantage so hes obviously going to shoot first. You shouldnt be punished for having better aim/positioning. Remove the shotgun and bring an SMG to the game, far less rng based.

6). There are too many cars. Its truly turned into car1z1 after the release of Z2. More carspawns, ATV spawns everywhere. And the way of fixing it isnt to buff the magnum (which is already op) or to blow all cars up after second safezone, that would ruin the game and within a month all slayers would just stop playing the game. Just spawn less cars. Copstation PV has 3 carspawns, turn it down to 2. G7 has 7 vechilespawns, turn that down to about 5. Reduce carspawns in "hotspots" where there already are a ton of spawns.

7). Hipfire is still overpowered as hell, which reduces the skillgap massively. Players with 2 hours in the game can two tap the best player in the world if theyre lucky.

8). Arclegger claimed that there are no bad spawns anymore. I can agree that if youre playing to win with less than 10 kills, sure spawns are amazing. However there new map has basically no hotspots anymore. G7, strip north of PV and the compound west of that are the only possible hotspots there are. On Z1, there were several hotspots, which were all easier to get to due ot the map being way smaller which also meant that the space between hotspots was way smaller. Warehouses, AK alley, big and small res, dam and suicide cabins. Even Cranberry could be pretty lit at times. Now you can honk your horn for 1 minute and not a single player will peek you in the city.

9). PV, and all other cities are too big. PV is suppose to be the place where you can get 10 kills without problem. Some games you even struggle to find 5 after the first gas starts spreading. The city is so big that there are no consistent hotspots. This makes the earlygame very frustrating and also boring in a lot of matches. Lets be honest, the huge park in the middle of PV is fucking useless.

10). Fighting mechanics are reducing the skillgap and extremely repetitive. Strafing one way while firing your gun, maybe crouching a bit aswell. There are no ways of outplaying opponents other than outaiming them (something which makes hit reg incosistensy even worse) Its all just really boring after doing the same thing for several thousand times. Bring back seatswapping and pronespamming, but nerf them, dont remove them. Bring in more fighting mechanics that you can use. Im not saying that snaking people was a very healthy mechanic when you could do that, but bring something new that makes the game fun to learn again. Adding so that fire exstinguishers could be blown up is a cool mechanic but lets be real, its used like once every 10th game. Jumpshooting was a relatively fun mechanic, I would love to see that back in the game.

11). The cross on your crosshairwhen standing close to a structure. Has anyone ever said that this is a good feature? Im pretty sure its all complains about this, how its completely unnecessary and shoulderpeeking is impossible if youre also prefiring.

12). Are nades ever going to be fixed? They have been like this for 4 months now and I dont recall Daybreak even metioning this a single time in patch notes or producers letter. They take so long time to throw, and if you throw fucking air instead of what your hand is holding, thats annoying. This cant be hard to solve can it?

13). The scoring system is unfair. EU spawns with 185-200 people per, while NA spawns with around 150. I know why Daybreak did this and I think its a pretty good idea to solve the queue times, but it gives EU a higher chance of getting high kill games and slightly higher scores. Im not a technician or something but doesnt more servers equal lower queue times? This can hardly be a problem considering the amount of money the game makes from all the crate they release (instead of fixing bugs). I get that crates make more money than fixing bugs etc, but keeping your players happy should imo be the highest priority.

Honorable mentions: Trees north of PV floating in the air Items spawning in the ground The cop car spawn in G7 (hard as fuck to enter) Items spawned on shelves unable to loot Sometimes when you tab out your game crashes Infinite running man. Not being able to see killer and killers health (lets see where they move after killing us though) Hunting Rifle only being usable in first person (not really an issue but it was more fun in 3rd person) Getting stuck in your inventory AK sound glitch Proximity chat turning off for no real reason without you changing your settings. Shadows cant be turned off. Its so easy to just allow players to turn them off. Low FPS players have more opportunities to make the game playable (I played on 20 fps and it sucks) Thank you for not patching the region switching glitch though.

I know that all the devs are probably going to ignore this completely, I just wanted to speak my opinion, and Im happy to see that Daybreak are hiring, Im hoping that improvements are coming in the near future. But despite from all that BS.. its only a ok game nothing serious. If you want to play in a good realistic game that make things challenging in some situations then my advice is play PUBG. Now if you want to stick with H1Z1 running around, and bomb rush people in a cartoonish gameplay then.. yah
They destroyed this game

The only marginally interesting or entertaining part of this game is it's history.

January 15, 2015: It's sold under the name of H1Z1. It was marketed as an open world zombie survival game, akin to DayZ. I bought it for 20$. The game does not run.

After a time, they release a new gamemode; King of the Kill. It's a battle royale mode, made specifically because PLAYERUNKNOWN made a hugely successful battle royale mod for the game but then split off to make his own game (PUBG).

February 5, 2016: KOTK is doing well, so they split it off from the game, both of them costing 20$. They silently abandon the original game, only doing small feature updates and adding nothing but bugs. H1Z1 (The survival game.) is renamed to H1Z1 Just Survive.  KOTK is renamed H1Z1: King of the Kill. Not long after they rename H1Z1 Just Survive to simply Just Survive (Which sounds like a terrible 3$ app game.) and rename H1Z1 King of the Kill to just H1Z1. (H1Z1 Battle Royale on consoles.) Development of the original survival game, "Just Survive", is still mostly halted.

October 24, 2018: Just Survive, the survival game i paid for, is shut down. The game is removed from my, and everyone else's steam library, with no refund. KOTK, or H1Z1, or H1Z1 Battle Royale...or...whatever the crap they named it, is shut down as well, and re-published and renamed as a different game, Z1 Battle Royale, obviously done to alienate the game from it's wretched history.

The kicker? It's free. Also, it's still called H1Z1 Battle Royale on consoles, and when Z1 BR is run, the window is named H1Z1. 

They made a game said it was like DayZ. It didn't even work. Then they simply deleted it from my library with no refund. Z1 BR is dead, it garners about 3 active players. They actually, legitimately built a fake game and then deleted it for money.

Utterly disgusting development team. When everyone said the original game was going down in flames due to terrible updates, horrible balancing fix attempts that only worsened the balance, and endless amounts of bugs spilling into the game, i sat there, with hope. This is what i got.

They said the original H1Z1 was originally going to be made free. I was fine, 20$ for instant beta access to a DayZ game was fine. What they didn't say is that it was a blatant lie and they would toss the game in the trash in favor of another random game they made using the original games assets (I told you. They're terrible. Too lazy to even make new assets.) simply because Fortnite was getting popular.

And after all that?

Anti-cheat was added (BattleEye), improvements was made.
Most the reviews seem to be for H1Z1: Just Survive mode which is still being improved. 

Since this review is about the Battle Royale mode which I placed 120+ hours into the game before the split.
This review will ONLY contain the Battle Royale (King of the Kills)
I will be reviewing each feature and part of the game in Anti-Cheat, Bugs, Gameplay and Microtransactions.

Review 2/18/206 Subject to change as updated:

Anti-Cheat: I've seen less hackers since the BattleEye Anti-Cheat have been added into the game, which is a huge improvement.
Once in awhile you meet one or two but they're quickly dealt with by the anti-cheat system after.

As expected with most games you will run into cheaters once in awhile this is not just subjected to H1Z1.
The anti-cheat system tends to handle everything pretty well.

Bugs these are the bugs I've encounter: I couldn't land on the ground and the parachute would flip all over the place.

Microtransactions: The game features microtransactions,  NOTE this is not GEAR but cosmetics and skins much like Counter Strike: Global offensive
Now days these is a common in games to feature cosmetic items. 


During special events and holidays Daybreak have feature special halloween skins that can be gained by just playing the game and getting special drop crates that drop during the fight.

These drop crates players must battle over to gain special skins and items to help their survival in battle royale free for all.


Gameplay: The overall gameplay is very fun, playing with randoms to playing with friends. The goal of this game is to be the last one standing.


If you love the Battle Royale Movies and Hunger Games, Want a battle of wits of fast thinking skills? This game is for you.


I would rate the game 7/10, the game still can use some major improvements but the overall gameplay is fun.

It's ironic that what started off as an open world zombie survival game, just keeps mutating and won't stay dead. 

Z1 Battle Royale (originally H1Z1: King of the Kill) is a Battle Royale title that spawned as an additional mode to the original H1Z1 (Just Survive). As the BR mode became more popular, both H1Z1 and the BR mode were split into two titles, where the zombie game received less and less updates until it was shut down and removed from Steam. 

H1Z1 would then be completely overshadowed by PUBG and Fortnite, and with a new Battle Royale game coming out every week with a new gimmick and play style, H1Z1 just refuses to die - recently re-branding to Z1 Battle Royale. With every re-brand comes a boost in the player base, although players will quickly realise why they stopped playing.

Z1 Battle Royale is now Free-to-Play, but with a dwindling player base, it probably won't be enough to bring it back to the level it was at just a few years ago. The game itself feels clunky, looks outdated and in my opinion, isn't worth the time.

This company use to be good, before they got sold off. This game had it's potential. This game was fun. This game is going to die now and this company, along with these developers are the reason why Early Access shouldn't exist on Steam. I personally think Steam should be doing some sort of test before letting games that are Early Access onto their platform. If only this company had a leader that could enforce a direction and change, rather than focusing on crates, then maybe this game would have done better. 

Apparently they decided to shut down Just Survive, which was the main reason why most people purchased this game, before it got separated into two. PUBG outshines this game now. If people would have spent less time spending money on crates and more time giving them critical feedback, maybe things would have been different. 

There are hardly any players on anymore and you can just see that by checking steam stats. The game itself lacks a lot of content. They removed the rain which made this game very atmospheric. The guns have horrible mechanics and crappy recoil, as well as spread. Everytime you shoot it feels like you're shooting with a wet noodle. The graphics are decent but that doesn't matter because of the lack of gameplay. The loot is somewhat decent. But the actual number of items such as guns currently in the game are small. I guess they tried is all I can say. It just wasn't enough.

All I'm doing now is just waiting, waiting for the moment they throw the final nail in the coffin and put this game to rest. I imagine it will be soon that we will see some news about H1Z1 shutting down forever and only being accessible on the Playstation. Which was one of their worst moves ever for the PC community. Farewell H1Z1.

Good ol' H1Z1, or whatever the hell it wants to be known as now. I've had two steam accounts that OWNED the game, as in, the night of release, our group of friends sat in wait for the servers to come online since we pre-ordered the game. While sitting on teamspeak, we waited until it was time and then spent over an hour trying to login and get setup while SoE and their dev team worked out the connection issues. Once we were in the game, playing, and building; we actually enjoyed it (as long as the servers stayed up; since we got kicked numerous times because of the server issues going on -- but hey, new game, nothing ever goes to plan. You can't expect a launch to go exactly how you planned, that's understandable). Spent over a week getting on, building up bases, raiding, and legit enjoying how the game was.

And then the first signs of a struggle came in the following years, SoE selling to Daybreak, all the flip-flopping, Battle Royale VS Survival. Then the free-to-play move, and finally they jabbed a nail in the coffin for Survival all together.

And here we are; 4 years and some months later, and H1Z1 practically is dead. With what started out as a Jan 15 release with over 15,000 players online, ended up at 0, and a King of the Kill / Royale / Transgender game that averages about 1,200 players a day (vs say Pubg's 300,000), it's safe to say that the game should just taken out back and put down.

Then you've got the technical elements, such as taking a beautiful engine such as Unreal Engine, and then producing the results that were done with the way H1Z1 looks now.... which is..... garbage. I've had the graphics up to ultra super max on 4k, and nothing, aside from putting a paper over your monitor, would help make the game look any better. If unlucky people out there happen to have lower-end PCs that don't support great graphics; well then, expect your environment and player model to look like something that resembles an indie remake of the movie "Toy Story".

All the people who decided to pre-order the game, really got screwed. And I mean "royally". Right in the rear, no lube, not even a free breakfast. Just a down-right gang-bang, and all you've got to show for it is a failed title sitting in your game library.

Steam has a feature now where you can request a game be completely removed from your library; you won't get your money back, but you can at least get rid of its existence from your own little world. That feature was made for games like this. No point in keeping H1Z1 in the library anymore if survival is dead, and I have no interest in playing a modern version of a game that resembles "Toy Story" quality.

The original release of the game was how I'd like to remember H1Z1. But now, the only thing I can remember in great detail, is how the game crashed and burned. In regards to the mess that is now known as "Z1 Battle Royale", I'll defend the developers by saying, they were high on large amounts of high-grade Columbian cocaine, had a 3-night binge with a hooker named Molly Munkhouse, and just received the sad news that they had contracted aids, herpes, syphilis, chlamydia, AND also were informed that their wife of 10 years was actually a guy with a bigger "wee-wee" than they had them-self. Any developer getting news such as that would botch a game up this bad, so that has to be the ONLY logical reason this game went THAT south.

What can you take away from this review? I'd rather take Britney Spears' black hole of a va-jay-jay out on a date, than subject myself to even 5 minutes more of this trailer trash.

Wait, now it's actually free like it was supposed to be all along?
What the hell...?

*EDIT* So this is what is super stupid:

This game was supposed to be free initially as a zombie survival game with the option to pay for early access. The battle royale mode came out and all of the sudden it became more popular than the survival mode. Then they split the game into two and dropped F2P??? WTF? 
Okay, so then we have King of the Kill and H1 Survive or whatever they called it. 
Now the BR is finally free like it should have been in the first place and is now called Z1 Battle Royale? 
WHAT THE HELL GUYS? PICK A NAME AND STICK WITH IT! So scatter brained it's no wonder that this fuckin mess bombed. (3 name changes, 2 pay wall changes, and splitting the game into two)

*EDIT 2* I'd just like to add that this game requires you to sit through THREE loading screens before getting into a game. The game's mechanics are trash. The movement requires 0 skill, shooting requires 0 skill, looting requires 0 skill. I can't even tell if the bullets are hit scans or projectiles. The recoil just feels so synthetic and stiff. There is no leaning. The buttons you'd expect to be for leaning are, strangely, used for healing. There is a button to change shoulders but the view change is so minor that it might as well not be there.

I lied: the mechanics are actually as mediocre as can possibly be - it plays pretty much like 3DO's 1999 release "Army Men" but with better controls and no noticeable ballistics while being consistently less fun. It is absolutely a game and it absolutely works but it is definitely not good at all. 

They also reduced the player count considerably and reduced the overall size of the playable area without adjusting the size of the minimap. The minimap is completely useless as a result.

Instead of jumping out of a plane you are now forced down immediately. This makes it almost impossible to be strategic about your drop location. The map is also very boring to look at and totally uninspired.

*EDIT 3* I HAVE CONFIRMED THAT THIS GAME DOES INDEED HAVE BALLISTICS! Albeit very rudimentary. The shooting is even more frustrating than I could have imagined. There is a deviation even if you are ADS. It means that you can miss shots that you shouldn't have missed, adding a luck factor and reducing skill base even further. 

Don't even try to use first person mode - especially the iron sights. The sights obscure your vision with no benefit to accuracy over TPP and you will be at a complete disadvantage vision-wise. This is absolutely a third person shooter.

Long story short: typical Early Access title where the devs use paying customers as video game testers then the devs take years to add content and generally do not optimize nor polish out the major bugs that have plagued the game since launch but release a so called finished product that they then often times neglect for a new game to make money on.

H1Z1 once had two game modes. The primary gamemode was a survival mode that is now* a standalone game titled Just Survive and a battle royale mode that was a tacked on side thought by the devs. It is your standard survival game: hit things to get loot to build base to hoard loot. It has changed major dynamics of both games so much that they are not anywhere near what each mode was like when the game started. H1Z1, at one time called King of the Kill, was the only popular battle royale mode before one or more of the developers left the company and made the very popular Player Unknowns Battlegrounds game. I have not played the auto royale variant but I have played every Twisted Metal sooooooo yea can anyone else believe Twisted Metal started waaaay back in 1995? Ah the memories. Recap: Devs broke game into two seperate games and changed the name of both at different times because these devs are conartists, exclusively.

Update 04-18-2018: Everytime a new update comes out I check the steam game stats. Everytime, less people play. The only thing positive about this dev studio is the pretend positivity the devs have typed out in the updates.

*Update 09-08-2018: The survival part of this game is officially discontinued. pfff H1 BR is certainly next.

Update 09-21-2018: Now they are renaming the battle royale part just like they did with survival before they killed that portion off.

Man H1Z1, This game was the game to rule them all. Back in the day, it was perfect. Not many bugs, tons of players, cool skins and good mechanics. But one day, daybreak bosses wanted more. They started to add more updates that no one wanted to pull in more people. This was when the game went to shit. They added stuff like a new recoil for all guns, then they added stuff like the SMG which ruined the shotgun fights that everyone loved. This game had it all, but they threw it away.

Now, Daybreak and NatG listen to the community (for once) and they realized that if they wanted to keep this game from dying they have to revert. And that's just what they did... They reverted to the time when everything was perfect, old map, old recoil, new showdown, good movement. Its all back ladies and gentlemen. For me H1Z1 has always had a special place in my heart. I loved this game so much. I was devastated to see it ruined by greedy Daybreak Bosses, while people like Carto wanted it fixed. Now that this game is back, the people are slowly coming back. Lots of streamers like Landon FPS and CDN The 3rd have played it and said they loved it. I want this game to come back, along with the community too. Its time to Bring the King of Battle royale back into the arena. LONG LIVE H1Z1!

[i]So, after buying H1Z1, playing for around 8 hours with friends 'n all that i was quite hyped back then. Until the devs and the game itself went pretty quickly down hill and my interest was lost.
After a few months passing by i was like 'shall i try it again' but skipped every time due the reviews, lack of time and the threads about the bugs/hackers and game breaking things.

Till the day today March 20th 2019.
Downloaded the game again cause i was bored and setted everything up to have a smooth 60 fps game with no problems at all. The pre-lobby is still the same as always and nothing is really changed to that in months. Even the weapons/items are still the same and the overall quality is pretty bad to be honest.

Anyway, i was just looting around grabbing the weapons and loot just like i did since the release (nothing changed) and *poof* someone infront of me suddently so i sprayed and prayed hes a$$ till he died and i was happy cause i got a kill.
5 minutes later i was in the top 10 and i saw a person having kills and kills over and over.
I was hiding in a corner while knowing nobody could know i could be there and guess what.
He prefired the sheit out of me while he couldn't know i was there so i clicked spectate.
And yea, he was hacking.

There is a lot more things i can tell you but right now the game isn't really playable in my opinion.
You're competing against very OP Z1 nolifers who probably have over a 1000 hours and more and there is noway you can kill these guys. 

Shortly explained,
Decent game when bored, playing against hackers/veterans who are undefeatable, decent quality overall but the devs are still lazy and a lot of progress isn't there.

Just gave it a try because I heard they brought it back to when the game was great. Well, they didn't. I miss the original Z1 map and until they bring that back, I can not agree with them that they brought it back. The current map is garbage and always was. But other than that, some may like that map and overall, the game ran smooth, you just won't see me playing it, but I can honestly say I would recommend it to people if they like the map, but if you were hoping for the original map, your SOL.

To irradiate on what I mean, for those that have played the original Z1 map, where Governor's mansion was in the NW part of the map, Pisspot creek, Dartmouth, Toxic waste and Runamok cabins was in the S/SW part of the map, the original Z1 is what I was expecting, not the later one where they made PV more in the  center and destroyed the overall flow of the map. 

I know some of you did not like that battles that took place on Veeshaun's Peek, or on Spence Hills, but, I thought those battles were some of the most fun I ever had and some of the most epic battles there. 

So, if you are expecting a game where they brought it back to the point in which made the game great and popular, they didn't, its a lie. They are on pretty much running Z1 2.0, (which to me and many others was the start of the decline), and not on the "Original" Z1.

I doubt anyone from NantG would read this, but if you want to make this game great again, go back to the Original Z1 and not to the Z1 2.0 map.

This game was a nightmare from early development with SOE mismanagement and the shoehorning of micro transactions. Now to salt the wound those of us who struggled through to enjoy H1Z1 have had the servers go offline and the game announced dead. 

Yet, here we are, the battle royal that was popular for a couple months and then fizzled out. These servers are still alive and well. So my $40 or whatever I paid way back when has now been burned and I have nothing to show for it but access to what has become a free to play attempt to milk what little audience is left. 

Don't even bother, because at this point it's just another battle royal that can't figure out fixing basic gameplay mechanics but has a firm hold on all sorts of skins. There are literally 100+ other options at this point, don't waste your time.
they ban people for reason and movement sucks ass

Before writing this review I was looking at others to see what they say, and I realised that a the people who dislike the game, most of them have less then 5 hours. This isn't a game you would like in the first day, you need to get into the game and learn how to play before saying it's trash. I think that the game is great, the skill gap is huge (That's why most the new players dislike the game), graphics aren't the best but overall very fun and enjoyable. One of the main reasons this game isn't that popular is because when a new player tries to learn the game they just get shit on against a player with 2000 hours or something, but once you get a few hours in the game and you start getting kills and wins this game is rewarding and fun. This game has also helped my aim in other FPS games as well because you need to have a good aim to play this and you learn a lot quicker then in other games if you just play this game for a while because the people you are being have a good aim so you end up learning quicker. If you do play this game and are new the first thing you need to do it turn your sensitivity down because otherwise you will miss a lot of your shots. I have 400 DPI and 17% mouse and 6% you should try something around that sens and get used to it and within a few days you will become a lot better at FPS games in general not this game. 
I think the game good, annoying at times but playing with friends makes this game amazing :).

Hello guys, the nantg team looks like they are actually fixing it slowly. I've been enjoyed the heck out of the game lately even though it isn't perfect. Hope they go the right way with the game. For now i recommend it again.
I think if you are going to bring this game back to life you should start at the beginning with "Just survive" or "H1Z1".

I enjoyed it, but it is not for everyone. The game can and will be unforgiving, laggy, and filled with sweaty annoying people. But considering the community of a lot of other games these days, it's not that hard to get by. You will ethier hate or love this game based on what you're willing to work with. In my mind was it worth the twenty dollars even though now it's free? Yes, yes it was.

(Please read) EDIT: After a few months, got tired of it. Just kinda an annoying game sitting in my library and having long updates now and then. Is boring to me, as is Fortnite and other battle royale games. So I guess I'm not the one to judge. But in the end, it's not really worth my time. Too many sweats to enjoy the game and too many long loading screens (like Fortnite). This is just my opinion and mind you I am no professional critic on battle royale games but as far as I'm concerned this game may be the original B.R. game but it won't be one of my favorite games or even one I really play at all.

Had to edit this review to accurately describe the current state of the game: Z1 IS BACK BABY! This might be my favorite shooting game since Quake 3.


This game can be brutal, but mastery can be rewarding. Maybe it's the "Dark Souls of battle royales". About 3 shots to the body can kill or 1-2 shots to the head (depending on if you have a helmet). I encourage new players to try the game and stay with it, along with being a positive member of the community!


Pro's
-guns have projectile physics: bullet speed & drop. This means it takes greater skill to hit shots at longer range.
-sound fx are rewarding and satisfying. I'm looking atchu, AR-15 reload sfx
-large skill gap. 
-sense of community. Proximity chat enables you to interact, joke, tease, antagonize, and revere like no other. Ranks are visible in the kill feed, you can see who to worry about/learn from. Go be weird, be funny, but please be respectful.

Con's
-graphics/color choices might be a turn off to some.
-not as beginner friendly as other games
-sometimes players can be toxic, but it's improving
-can be demanding on the CPU. This one is probably more dependent on CPU than GPU
-some people may consider the small variety of primary weapons to be unappealing, but the stategy is simple and deep.

Congrats to the OG team on returning and restoring this gem to glory. I look forward to what's to come and wish the game/team the best!

All these people that have barely any hours just come here to bash the old idea of H1Z1. This newly branded game (Z1BR) has a new dev team that are really paying attention to their community. Nantg has by far outperformed Daybreak in the couple months they have had control over the game and they are doing everything in their power to make this game the best it can be. If you enjoy a challenge then this game is for you. This is by far the hardest BR to master. People play the game for 2 hours and expect to be gods. Then, they turn around and write a review calling the game trash without putting in the time to become a good player. I don't understand why everyone is listening to the opinions of a person that has 0.4 hours played. I've played since preseason 3 (900 hours) and I have never reached royalty rank. The highest rank I've achieved is master 2 during season 1 but the game is still tons of fun. Nothing feels better than getting that 2 tap. I do admit it has been hard to get into the game in the recent months before the new update,  but with the new season 3 update the game feels great again. The gameplay is much smoother and lobbies are filling again. The introduction of the ranked pro mode (that just opened up this weekend) is allowing newer players the opportunity to grind the game without the elite players ruining their learning experience. Give this game a serious chance and you'll see that it's much more rewarding to master than any other BR. Just be positive and don't let others opinions persuade you into disliking a game without giving a serious chance yourself.

Wow. Just wow. And I thought Fortnite was bad. Let's look at the path of evolution shall we? Every ">" means progression in time. Let's begin: H1Z1 Zombie Survival > H1Z1 (now has Battle Royale) > (Game splits) > H1Z1 Just Survive, H1Z1 King of the Kill > (H1Z1 drops the franchise title all together and simply becomes Just Survive), (H1Z1 KotK becomes just King of the Kill) > (A lead developer of KotK realizes that it is a failure and not what he imagined when he created H1Z1 battle royale mode a few years prior so he leaves Daybreak and becomes PLAYER UNKNOWN and develops PUBG) > (KotK now becomes simply H1Z1 again, except no zombie survival, Just Survive is failing FAST) > (The now H1Z1 is made into a free to play game while Just Survive remains $19.99) > (PUBG and Fortnite soar in popularity and quickly become the leads in the Battle Royale genre) > (Daybreak decides that the only thing they need anymore is H1Z1 is all they need and finally realize the abandoned child of a game Just Survive is only hurting the company so they shut its doors for good) > (H1Z1 is yet again rebranded... AGAIN) > Z1 Battle Royale.   

And that ladies and gents, is the tale of how we got from the glorious zombie survival game H1Z1 to the trash it is today. Thanks Daybreak. #RIPH1Z1

When H1Z1 initially came out I bought this game because it was a Survival game that was leaps and bounds ahead of DayZ. The base building was fun as hell. When I got into the game it was widely known that you were buying advanced access to the game and that when Sony planed on it being a FTP game once it released. 
They brought on PlayerUnknown to help develop his DayZ mod into this game making King of the Kill the first game that had what everyone knows today as Battle Royale. Then PU caught a bad smell in the air from DayBreak and left to make PUBG.

I never played King of the Kill. I never had any desire to play that type of game. The survival portion was what I loved. Yes I am one of the thousands of players that really hate what Daybreak did to this game after they took over from Sony. 
Maybe the new Devs can get the Zombie survival game going again too. I doubt it though. 
As it is PubG and even Apex are much better BRs and Apex is free as well.

Z1 and its magic. i love the essence of the world, parachuting from the sky knowing in your mind that someone is going to land on the same building as you.  The same old stress runs through your veins reaching your brain, which turns you into full focus mode. But what shatters ones heart is when dying to a person that had better cover. Yes indeed. heart breaking, hand smashing indeed. However, the satisfactory of getting the 2-Tap is Holy.  Might be too holy, might as well listen to the gore splatter on a loop. Now comes to the appearance of the game, well you might say, " Damn this guy looks dope" well the truth is, everyone is a fashonista if you ask me, you know what i am saying (wink) (wink). Overall, Z1 is very mythical for what it has and stands. Just one last thing, make sure to buy a extra pair of keyboards and mouse, you will need it. Oh and if you break your hand then its completely normal.

This game is beautiful. Just like all you humans out there are beautiful <3. The graphics make you "feel" like you are chasing people around in the real world with a cop car blasting your siren. Two tapping kids and taking names. Or the people who you kill, recognizing your skills in voice chat by calling you a hacker. Or just starting a general conversation. There are people out there who you will meet and talk to that will become your life-long friends. The game isn't perfect but what game is? This game started the whole battle royale genre and other BRs are childplay compared to this. Twitch streamers such as Stormen and DrDispresctive have called this the hardest BR out there. If you want a challenge, press that free to play button. You will not regret it. What do you have to lose??

VERY GOOD GAME

This game can be bittersweet, like any shooter. You will rage when you die too many times in a row off spawn or a guy one pumps you with a shotgun, but all in all, no game can compare in terms of kill satisfaction. When you headshot someone in this game or win, it is truly an accomplishment that feels euphoric. Nothing compares to that adrenaline in the industry. Put the time in combat zone to hone your skills. If you are new, it will not take as long as it seems to catch up to the skill levels of others that have had this game for years. You will start by getting one kill here or there and then suddenly you will feel comfortable with the mechanics. Give the game a chance. If you are an old h1z1 veteran, give the devs a chance to win your trust back. You just might like what you see if you aren't all caught up in the "dead game" meme. If the game is fun, don't let a meme hold you back from good times. I recommend giving this game a shot to everyone. What do you have to lose? It is free. :)

Update: This game is now under new management starting September. Every complaint anyone has ever had against the dev team of the past is a thing of the past. Updates are prompt, community driven, and good. There is a perfect amount of new content/bug fixes so far. Stick around to see the progress the game will make. It is actually insanely good fun again. Check Z1roadmap.com to see the plans for this game. It wil soon be called Z1 Battle Royale. I have always loved this game alongside many others. Once again, it is free to go in and try out the changes. You lose nothing :)

Update 2: Following the update to the game on March 6th, 2019 the game is insanely fun again. Lobbies are full. The gameplay feels fulfilling, and any bugs are quickly tracked and patched. The game has officially returned to the mechanics of the glory days (aka pre-season 3) This game is the BR that started the craze. It is free to play with no pay to win features. See where the big streamers like Ninja, Summit1G, CDNthe3rd, and Dr. Disrespect got their start ;)

Ignore any reviews that predate March 6th 2019. 

This game is fun again. 

Under new management, Z1BR just received a gigantic update that overhauled movement and animations, as well as texture, lighting, and color. While there are a few minor bugs to zap and a little polishing of the movement, the overall feel is back to the state that made the original game so much fun to play in the first place. 

The gun mechanics offer a unique gaming experience that is sure to test the skills of even the most adept gamer. That's not to say the game doesn't hold any appeal to more casual players. With a rotation of arcade modes available to play every weekend and a bunch of hosted servers that allow streamers to run their own game types, there is something for everyone. 

The game is free to play, so try it out for yourself.

Game has had lots of ups and down. a few development teams. This update feels like the best the game has ever been. its fun again. do yourself a favor and try it out. dont give up to easy. once you start hitting 2 taps and get a flow, the game really gets interesting . ENJOY!

It's been quite a journey for the dev team and community, but Z1 feels great again! It shouldn't matter if you miss a pellet or two close range to the face. Theres no worse of a feeling than headshotting someone at point blank and dying to a body shot and seeing them still have 4 health. Great update so far, just some MINOR fixes and itll be perfect!

The former H1Z1 KOTK and H1Z1 was under the guidance of Daybreak Games. This was a company with a great dev team yet they were choked by their bosses who forced out many things that the community didn't want. Most of these devs switched to NantG to restore this game to its former glory. And they succeeded. Many of those people who were once in love with the game yet left came back. And thanks to NantG, this Z1 Battle Royale community is coming back together. All in all, the reviews on this game may be primarily negative because of the former situation this game was in... But now it is great for those who are true fans from the past.....  WELCOME HOME!

A little over a year since my last review, i decided to change some things after this past update. This has become a solid/fun/enjoyable game as of 3/6/2019. That said, I will not continue to play it. This being because I am burned out of all the BR games that are being shoved out. If you have not played a BR or you still feel interested in playing them, this is definitely a good game for you. I originally paid for this game, along side the main game (the zombie survival mode), and if they could somehow bring that back, that's something I would be interested in putting many more hours in to.

You know what...

Regardless of what happens in this game. Whatever happens for H1 in the future.

Just know,

I've had some of the best times of my life on this game. This is what MADE battle royale. Fortnite, PUBG, and any another BR game on Steam oughta pay their respects. This is what started it.

Now now, I'll have some Arma 3/DayZ fags in here talking about thats where it all began but believe me, H1 was the game that put that shit up on a pedestal.

Regardless if this game makes a comeback or not, it'll always have a place in my heart. I will ALWAYS give it a shot no matter how many updates they come out with.

I do honestly hope this game can make a comeback. I am not so optimistic about it(the numbers are already dwindling) but with every inch of my soul, I hope this game can do well. 

But again, regardless of what happens, THANK YOU to the new devs who have put forth a serious effort into trying to get this game back to its glory days.

Whatever way this game chooses to go, just know, I will never forget this game.

I have over 200 hours on the new map and had clocked over 400 on the last. These devs dont give a damn about this game, and they supplement all of their mistakes for skins and crates. The shooting mechanism in this game needs to be scratched and rebuilt from the ground up. They consistently add new POI's, but the spawns every single round are the same, and usually consist of 20 people landing in the same area. This game is 95% RNG, and the other 5% is a skill. Nothing in this game is ever consistent, especially shotguns, which is by far the most broken gun in the game. In fact, the last update claimed to have largely improved the shotguns consistency, and now it will shoot all six rounds at the same time and screw you over in short ranged gunfights. Even if you land that single shot, it's not going to kill the other player, and will most likely damage the other player a max of 10 hp, regardless of the range.

Overall, this game is trash, but I continue to fund these idiot devs, and their plans of keeping games in early access to max out on their cash grab. Don't be like me.

Thoughts: Daybreak Games cannot fix any bugs and is a money hungry company that has little to no care about their product that could be great...  They do not permanently ban cheaters (they only give them temp bans), and they allow popular streamers to cheat on stream without punishment.  The game would be great if they would just fix a couple of things... #1: Get new servers #2: fix the desync issues #3: perma ban cheaters (even popular streamers that cheat) #4: get rid of the foreigners that plague the US servers #5: fix other bugs/issues #6: release new content (such as different weapons, vehicles, maps, skins, increase players in the map from 150 to 200, ranking system for 2s & 5s, better type of leaderboards that shows in depth stats (not just wins/kills but like headshots/vehicle kills/kills with specific weapons/assists/bullets shot/accuracy/so on and so on), etc...

Additions 1: the game has been updated into the ground, every patch and update that hits this game, slowly kills and ruins it more and more and they still constantly refuse to perma ban hackers, which is why im changing the game rating from 8 to... 6 out of 10... (December 2017)

Additions 2: the game is in a worse state than when it had the horrible combat update lol why are the characters so slow now??? how hard is it to REVERT to 2016..? ALL OF THAT CODE SHOULD STILL EXIST FROM EVERY PATCH... and also they still refuse to ban popular streamers that have cheated in the past, and who knows if they are still cheating to this day... as well as probably still refusing to ban other cheaters too... changing the game rating from 6 to... 5 out of 10... Back when i bought H1Z1 it was actually "H1Z1" a zombie survival crafting game. I immediately fell for this game despite its numerous game breaking problems to name a few: Performance problems, entire cities walled off by clans, frozen zombies, constant hackers, and a Chinese population so great on NA and EU servers that it literally started a unspoken race war fought between the entire world against the Chinese lag bandits-- although this was kinda funny.

I actually met many friends from this game, including a really good friend of mine whom i'm still friend's with 3 years after.
This game had amazing potential-- And i watched that potential cross the event horizon NEVER to be seen again.

I was there when they announced a survival game using Planetside 2's Engine..
I was there watching those developer streams..
I was there when they made the promises..
I was there when the game split in two..
I was there when the developers left us..

You killed my most played steam game, it took an entire year of not playing H1Z1 (Just survive) to overtake the hours played. AND EVEN STILL its my 2nd most played steam game.

You had our hearts and our wallets in your hands and you dropped us in the gravel for the BR BS.
And look where it left you.. I would say this mistake is killing you,[b] but you're already dead. [/b]

Personally I do enjoy this game and while this game certainly does have its ups and downs, I am not here to praise or criticize this game. I am here to offer a phenomenal 4 Cheese Ravioli recipe!

Here are the ingredients you will need!

Ravioli Dough: 2 cups all-purpose flour, 1 pinch salt, 1 teaspoon olive oil, 2 eggs, 1 1/2 tablespoons water.

Ravioli Filling: 1 (8 ounce) container ricotta cheese, 1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese, softened, 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese, 1/2 cup provolone cheese, shredded, 1 egg, 1 1/2 teaspoons dried parsley.

Pesto-Alfredo Cream Sauce: 2 tablespoons olive oil, 2 cloves garlic, crushed, 3 tablespoons prepared basil pesto sauce, 2 cups heavy cream, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese, 1 (24 ounce) jar marinara sauce.


1. Mound the flour and salt together on a work surface and form a well. Beat the teaspoon of olive oil, 2 eggs, and water in a bowl. Pour half the egg mixture into the well. Begin mixing the egg with the flour with one hand; use your other hand to keep the flour mound steady. Add the remaining egg mixture and knead to form a dough.

2. Knead the dough until smooth, 8 to 10 minutes; add more flour if the dough is too sticky. Form the dough into a ball and wrap tightly with plastic. Refrigerate for 1 hour.

3. While the dough is resting, prepare the ravioli filling. Combine the ricotta cheese, cream cheese, mozzarella cheese, provolone cheese, egg, and parsley and mix well. Set the filling aside.

4. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the crushed garlic and pesto sauce and cook for one minute. Pour in the heavy cream, raise the heat to high, and bring the sauce to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the Parmesan cheese and stir until the cheese melts. Remove the pan from the heat and keep warm.

5. Meanwhile, in a separate saucepan, warm the marinara sauce over medium-low heat.

6. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Beat the egg with the tablespoon of water to make the egg wash.

7. Roll out the pasta dough into thin sheets no thicker than a nickel. To assemble the ravioli, brush the egg wash over a sheet of pasta. Drop the filling mixture on the dough by teaspoonfuls about one inch apart. Cover the filling with the top sheet of pasta, pressing out the air from around each portion of filling. Press firmly around the filling to seal. Cut into individual ravioli with a knife or pizza cutter. Seal the edges.

8. Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Stir in the ravioli, and return to a boil. Cook uncovered, stirring occasionally, until the ravioli float to the top and the filling is hot, 4 to 8 minutes. Drain well.

9. Grease a baking sheet. Place the cooked ravioli on the sheet pan and bake in the preheated oven until brown, about 4 minutes.

10. To serve the ravioli, divide them among four warmed serving bowls. Drizzle the marinara sauce over the ravioli and then top with the cream sauce.

Do not support this terrible company. I paid good money for a game they abandoned for this battle royale TRASH.

They ruined a good thing here, h1z1 used to be post apocalyptic warfare where you scavenge, craft, build and survive. 

I spent hundreds of hours on this game til they added in Battle Royale then they split the game in two and abandoned Just Survive, reaching for the cash grab which was Battle Royale at the time.

What a shame, we probably won't see another game such as Just Survive for a while as the hype of zombie survival has died down which is why they abandoned it and made a BR game.

A quick history of H1Z1:
Daybreak creates a game called H1Z1, a zombie survival game. Two modes available, Suvival and Battle Royale. Dev decides to take one game, and split it into two seperate games (Just Survive & King of the Kill) because fawk you, that's why. Focuses more on BR modes cause more money from microtransactions. Decides to stop supporting Just Survive and pulls plug on paying customers, also because fawk you. May possibly Just Survive IP to a mobile dev because who the fawk cares they got your money.

Lesson to learn:
Never buying another Daybreak title.

As much as I want to make this review not a negative one I can't.
I was in love with this game since I bought it in 2016, when I saw it on Twitch, and it was the best BR that I've ever seen. (btw, I still think that the Pre-season 2 or 3 is the best BR that was ever made). I spent only 200 hours on this game, and I regret that I haven't played it when it was at it's peak. The mechanichs were perfect, the recoil, bullet-drop and even my old-ass Pentium G3220 could run this game at 50-60 fps in Pleasant Valley.
Everything went downhill when they decided to do the PUBG update (combat update in August 2017), and they started losing a lot of players, now it's a crappy thing with 20 players in a match.
If I could revive any game it'd be H1Z1 (both Just Survive and King of the Kill), because when it was updated only for passion, not trying to make a lot of money and gain new players in many risky ways that'd bring the game to the stage where it's now, it was gaining a lot of popularity, and it was really good.
I lost all my hope about this game, and when I finally deleted it yesterday I was feeling kinda sad, about the memories that I had with this game.
Rest in peace, power and love, good old friend.

p.s.: I recommend it only beacause it brought me in a lot of groups where I made friends that i still talk to, even today, and I had a lot of fun playing it in it's early pre-season days(with the old-new Z2 and UI).

Its player base has dropped exponentially, making it nearly impossible to get into a squads game. Its competitors have improved their games at much faster rates than H1Z1 could keep up with, but H1Z1 will still be the game that started it all. This game was a unique game that had a pve mode and a survival mode as well as a battle royale mode. But it threw all those extra modes away to focus on becoming a second rate fortnite clone.

This game was the first of its kind that paved the way for games such as Fortnite, PUBG and even Blackout to propel forward into the genre. H1Z1 in its prime was revolutionary in my opinion, I have never had as much fun in any game as I have had when it was Preseason 3/4 of this game. My friends and I would sit down and play for hours upon hours, grinding the ranks trying to get up to Royalty and once you finally achieved it, you felt on top of the world. 
The combat of this game was entirely new and fresh, you had to have amazing hand/eye coordination to perform the infamous 2 taps and the crunch of the headshot was enough to want me to play more even upon losing. I will forever say that H1Z1 in its prime was my favorite game to play out of all the varied and vastly different titles I have played. 
However, the Combat Update has ruined this game and dug it into an impossibly deep hole that even to this day, they haven't escaped it. The combat system was changed, the UI was odd and clunky, the models were different, the shotgun was basically useless, everything that we loved about this game proceeded to sink into the ground. Daybreak had EVERYTHING in their hands with this game and in a blink of an eye, washed it all away. 
Even with the new direction they are taking with Jace Hall leading the charge, I don't ever see this game coming back to how it once was and that is okay. I can say that I was there and I experienced it in full charge and now I can move on to other games, letting go of what it once was.

As you can see by my 1000+ active hours in H1Z1 I have aways loved this game even from its early stages of development. This game was a big part of my life as it also helped me reach out to so many different communities and meet Friends that I still talk to today. Alot of my best gaming memories will be with this game because it gave me the greatest feeling I had never experienced with the BR genre. One day I hope H1Z1 will get back the following I was once apart of. If maybe JUST maybe the dev's hadn't have messed up everything with the games development, Then I wouldn't be writing this review I would instead be playing it and loving every second of it along the way. But it isn't anything 1 single person can control and it is something I have to accept.
 

I have recommended the game because the current devs have tryed to develop it back to its former glory with the help of the community. Even though this is something that should have been done in the past when the following was at peak to develop it further. Still this shows that they are better. This also shows that they have learned there lesson and that they will better work with the community in the future (I hope). so I recommended H1Z1 not because the company deserves the playerbase back, but because The community deserves their playerbase back. Too many players have been left in the dark because of this dying game and im sad to be apart of it.


This game will always have a special place in my heart which is why I am of course sad to see it go. As much as I want to hatepost about this game (which is taking every ounce of me not to do). I would instead like to thank H1Z1 and the communities that made it a special place for someone like me. I had hoped that in the near-future people will see all the good of H1Z1 in its current state and everyone would all come flooding back. But I have long now accepted and have come to terms with the projected future of the playerbase. So I would like to one last time here on the steam review section say goodbye, and thank you H1Z1. 


This review goes out to all of the longtime players of the H1Z1 community!!!
